"Map point" widget
The "Map point" widget
is a tool that allows users to add a map inside of an object profile. It is used to show objects on the map with the ability to place points (further referred to as placemarks) on the specified address or specified coordinates.
Example of a configured widget
:
In order to fully implement the functionality of the widget, the
attribute
composition of the object type or its parent type should contain:
"String" type attribute for entering/displaying the address;
numeric type attribute for entering/displaying the latitude;
numeric type attribute for entering/displaying the longitude;
The widget is added to the object profile in the editing mode of the
visual of an instance
. Drag-and-drop the "Map point" widget from the "Widgets" tab of the "Elements" window to the working area.
The widget can be dragged only into the "Row" grouping element that can be found in the "Groupings" tab of the "Elements" window.
Settings
Click "Settings" to start the widget configuration.
A modal window opens in which the following settings are available:
Setting
Purpose
Height, px
Sets the height of the widget in the profile.
The numeric value is entered in the range from 150 to 1500.
Reading mode
When the switch is in active position, moving the placemark on the map via the mouse cursor will be disabled. Changing the placemark position will be possible through latitude, longitude and address parameters
Latitude, degrees
Selecting a numeric type attribute that displays the value of the geographical coordinate that determines the position of the placemark on the map in the North-South direction.
Longitude, degrees
Selecting a numeric type attribute that displays the value of the geographical coordinate that determines the position of the placemark on the map in the West-East direction.
Type of map
Selecting the map display type from the following options:
1. Google;
2. OpenStreetMap.
API key
The field for entering API keys required to work with "Google" maps. Keys are not required for the "OpenStreetMap" map type, its fields are displayed in an encrypted form.
Marker image
The image for the placemark can be selected via the list or added manually. To add an image, click the options button on the right side of the field, click "Add", select an image and click "Open". Acceptable file formats: jpg, png.
Address
Selecting an attribute of the "String" type which is displaying the address of the placemark on the map.
To save changes, click "OK".
The display of the map and the placemark on the map depends on the selected settings, for example, when the "OpenStreetMap" map type is selected, the widget for the end user will be presented as shown below:
The map sclae is changed using:
zoom buttons located in the lower right corner of the map;
computer mouse scroll wheel;
"+" and "—" buttons on the keyboard.
To determine the current location on the map, click on the corresponding button on the map.
The button for determining the current location is active when GreenData is granted access to location data.
For example, the instructions for configuring access in the Chrome browser are provided
in the following link
. Instructions for the Opera browser
are here
.
To move around the map, you need to click and hold the mouse cursor on the map area, and drag the cursor in the desired direction. You can also use the keyboard arrows.
Example
Let’s create the "Location"
object type
with "Latitude", "Longitude" and "Address" attributes.
After opening the
registry
of the created type, add an
instance of the type
and proceed to
setting up the visual
.
Drag-and-drop type attributes and the "Map point" widget from the "Elements" panel to the workspace.
After opening the widget settings, specify the corresponding attributes in the "Longitude", "Latitude" and "Address" fields.
Add a png file as a marker image (the image has no background). In this case, we will specify "Google" as the map type, and add the network key in the "API key" field.
After saving the widget and visual settings, the profile will take the following form:
The placemark on the map can be set:
by clicking on the area of the map;
by entering a value in the "Address" field and pressing Enter;
by specifying the coordinates of the longitude and latitude of the location in the appropriate fields, then pressing Enter.
The numeric value of the attribute that is passed to the "Latitude" setting is entered in degrees as a decimal fraction in the range from -90 to 90.
The numeric value of the attribute that is passed to the "Longitude" parameter is entered in degrees as a decimal fraction in the range from -180 to 180.
These methods are interrelated, i.e. when one value changes, the others automatically change as well.
